title: 108_hr2195
content: The Act titled "Smithsonian Facilities Authorization Act" provides additional space and resources for national collections held by the Smithsonian Institution. The Board of Regents of the Smithsonian Institution is authorized to expand storage and laboratory space in Suitland, Maryland for national collections. Appropriations of $2,000,000 for 2003, $10,000,000 for 2004, and necessary funds for 2005-2008 are approved. Additionally, improvements to the Patent Office Building are authorized. The Board of Regents of the Smithsonian Institution is authorized to plan, design, and construct improvements to the Patent Office Building using nonappropriated funds. The design and specifications for any exterior alterations must be submitted to the Commission of Fine Arts for review and approval. The Board of Regents of the Smithsonian Institution is authorized to plan, design, and construct improvements to the Patent Office Building, subject to review and approval by the National Capital Planning Commission and the Advisory Council on Historic Preservation. The Smithsonian Institution is considered an agency for compliance with regulations from the Advisory Council on Historic Preservation. The Secretary of the Smithsonian Institution has the authority to enter into multi-year contracts for property and services. They can also enter into contracts for severable services that span across fiscal years. This section applies to contracts made after the enactment of this Act. SEC. 5. The Secretary of the Smithsonian Institution may establish a program for voluntary separation incentive payments for employees, similar to the program under title 5, United States Code. SEC. 6. Sense of Congress regarding Jazz Appreciation Month. Congress approved House Concurrent Resolution 57 in 1987, designating jazz as a national American treasure. Jazz has inspired leading artists and is a cultural export of the United States. It is an original American art form that bridges cultural differences and should be part of the educational curriculum for children. The Smithsonian Institution has played a vital role in preserving jazz heritage. The Smithsonian Institution's National Museum of American History has established Jazz Appreciation Month in April to honor jazz as a historic American art form. The museum has received support from various governmental agencies and cultural organizations. Congress commends the museum for this initiative and encourages other organizations to develop programs to celebrate jazz. The Smithsonian Institution's National Museum of American History has established Jazz Appreciation Month in April to honor jazz as a historic American art form. Congress commends the museum for this initiative and encourages other organizations to develop programs to explore, perpetuate, and honor jazz as a national and world treasure.
